h3. Summary
Service Desk 3 onwards allows wiki mark up in request type descriptions, eg: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
{color:Red} red text {color}
{code}
See:  
!request type edit.png|thumbnail!  
!portal.png|thumbnail! 

This causes the markup to appear correct when viewing the specific portal page, but when viewing all portals in the help center the wiki markup displays as text.  
See:  
!help center.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk
# Edit the request type description to include markup

h3. Expected Results
The markup is transformed in both the portal and the help center

h3. Actual Results
The markup is transformed only in the portal but not in the help center
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Help Center does not transform request markup

fields.description:
How to replicate ?
- Create two Projects, One should be Service Desk type.
- Make sure the Default Priority is "Low" from the priorities section
- Go to the Service Desk project and hide the Priority field from the Field configuration. 
- Create a ticket in Service Desk project
- Click on "Create linked issue" button and create a ticket to the second project
- You should see the priority will be set to "Highest" or "Blocker"

What was the expected result ? 
The priority should be set to "Low" as the default based on the global setting.

If you show the priority field in the Service Desk project, it will set the priority correctly. Only when you hide the field, JIRA is setting the priority to Highest value for the hidden Priority.

Workaround : 

Create the ticket first in the targeted project then Link using the "Link" section
fields.summary: Priority is always set to "Highest" in the target Project when "Create Linked Issue" is used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4772].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
After upgrading to JSD 3.3.0, a pop-up window which should allow users to click on a "Migrate Now" link to disable legacy transitions does not work with error as shown in screenshot below. 
 !automation.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* The affected project workflow has legacy transitions. To identify this, please follow the *Resolution: Check your JIRA Service Desk project workflow properties* as outlined in [this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-this-service-project-may-not-work-as-expected-error-777027034.html#HowtofixThisserviceprojectmaynotworkasexpectederror-CheckyourJIRAServiceDeskprojectworkflowproperties].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In an instance with JSD 2.3.6, create a JSD project and make sure there are legacy transitions in the project's workflow.
# Upgrade the instance to JSD 3.0.0.
# Upgrade the instance to JSD 3.3.0.
# Create an Automation rule to transition on comment (the default one).

h3. Expected Results
An "Automation is the future" message will appear and users should be able to click on the "Migrate Now" link to disable legacy transitions.

h3. Actual Results
* An "Automation is the future" message will appear but when users click on the "Migrate Now" link, an error occurs (see screenshot) and the "Automation is the future" message continue to appear from time to time.
* In the *Network* tab of the browser developer tool, there will be a PUT request send to site URL like {{http://localhost:8080/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/disableLegacyTransition/1}} with status code 404, which means not found.

h3.Workaround
# Identify the transition ID from the last part of the URL of the request.
#* For example, *ID = 1* for {{http://localhost:8080/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/disableLegacyTransition/1}}
# Update via database with the SQL query below.
#* {code:SQL}update "AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK" set "LEGACY_TRANSITION_DISABLED"='t' where "ID" = 1;{code}
#* If only _int_ is allowed for the "LEGACY_TRANSITION_DISABLED" column {code:SQL}update "AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK" set "LEGACY_TRANSITION_DISABLED"=1 where "ID" = 1;{code}
# Restart JIRA.
(i) Always back up your data before performing any modification to the database. If possible, try your modifications on a test server.
fields.summary: The "Migrate Now" link to disable legacy transitions is not working

fields.description:
{panel:title=Engineering Review|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Thanks, everyone for your patience on this.

 *1. Regarding the issue with not having the auto-completion on the UserPicker* 

For the auto-completion to show in that context, you need to have the appropriate permissions configured, and the user must be part of an organization. We have updated our documentation to make these requirements more clear: [Managing access to your service project - Choose who customers can share requests with|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/managing-access-to-your-service-project-939926273.html#Managingaccesstoyourserviceproject-Choosewhocustomerscansharerequestswith]

 *2. Regarding the issue with not being able to use email addresses in the UserPicker* 

Once the requirements mentioned in the previous point are met, you will be able to search for existing customers using their email addresses in the UserPicker (according to any user filtering rules that you have in place). However, regardless of the permissions, you won’t be able to add the email addresses of people who aren’t customers. Such external email addresses can be added only through the *Share request* and *Raise request on behalf of* fields.

The confusion comes from the fact that the UI component offering the ability to “Add new customer” is generic. It is the same component that is used by the *Raise request on behalf-of* field, but the intended behavior is different. We’ve also updated our documentation to emphasize this, and raised a ticket to update the UserPicker UI component to hide this functionality in the contexts where it can’t be used: JSDSERVER-8346
 
I hope this helps!

Yann
 Software Engineer - Jira Service Management
{panel}
h3. Summary

In JIRA Service Desk 3.2.6, administrators may configure a Service Desk's Request Security so that customers can see other users, when filling in a user field, if "they... enter the exact email or username in a user field".

In JIRA Service Desk 3.3.0+, the structure and wording of this functionality was changed slightly, and administrators may instead configure a Service Desk's Customer Permissions so that customers may share requests with "Any customer, by typing an email address".

(x) In *either* case, customer's actually cannot fill in these users if they enter their full email address; only when using their full username. This is misleading and confusing in the circumstances where the user security is set and customers wish to pull in other customer's via email address (when they don't know the other customer's usernames).

See behavior in Service Desk 3.2.6:
 !3.2.6_User_Search_Email.png|thumbnail!

See behavior in Service Desk 3.3.0:
 !3.3.0_User_Search_Email.png|thumbnail!

 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a "User Picker (Single User)" custom field and associate it with the Service Desk screen
 # Modify a Request Type in the Service Desk so that the form incorporates that custom field
 # Depending on the version of Service Desk being used, configure Request Security (Service Desk 3.2.x and below) or Customer permissions (Service Desk 3.3.x and above) for the security option which allows customers to select other users if provided a full username/email address (no searching).

h3. Expected Results

A customer should be allowed to fill out the form by providing either the full username or the full email address of the user they intend to add.
h3. Actual Results

The error message "Please provide a valid value for field 'UserPicker'" is thrown, even if a valid email address is provided. Only the full username will be accepted.
h3. Notes
 * As of SDS 4.1.0, the user picker field suggestions do not work unless the permissions are set to "Any customer or organization, by searching in this project".
 * The customer having the global "Browse users" permission does not change this behavior.

h3. Workaround
 # Use the username of the user to be picked, rather than the email address (unless you're in JIRA Service Desk 3.16.+, step two is the only viable workaroud).
 # Change the Service Desk's Request Security/Customer permissions to "Any customer or organization, by searching in this project" to allow the suggestions to work in user picker fields.
fields.summary: Customers cannot search for users in the customer portal request forms via email address when customer permissions are restricted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4764].
  {panel}

It's a bit cumbersome to add a new customer from service desk. You can add an email address, but not set the user's full name.

Once the email is added, we then have to go into jira users admin, edit the user, and then set the name on a separate screen. It would be great to be able to do this in one shot.

I usually copy and paste names/addresses from my email client, and the generic standard for names and addresses is: First Last <name@company.com>.

It would be great to be able to paste this in as one unit right into service desk to add the user and set the name.

 

It should also be able to parse

'First Last' <name@company.com>

"First Last" <name@company.com>

 

And also, all these combinations, using: Last, First

 

Ideally there would also be a plugin hook where there can be the ability to add to these rules or replace them with the administrators choice of functionality.
fields.summary: Ability to specify user's full name when adding to jira service desk customer

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4743].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Webhook based on JQL does not trigger when SLA fields are used and the event set to fire the Webhook is the Issue creation event.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SD project
# Set a webhook based in JQL like this:
{code}
"Time to first response" = withinCalendarHours() and project = XYZ.
{code}
Set so the webhook will be triggered in the creation issue event.

h3. Expected Results
The webhook is fired when an issue is created in the service desk if during the working hours in the calendar applied.

h3. Actual Results
The webhook is never fired.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround, but the user may try to manipulate the date of issue creation in the JQL to meet its criteria:
{code}
created > date and created < date
{code}
fields.summary: Webhook triggered by Issue Creation is not sent when JQL filter users SLA fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4742].
  {panel}

We have one JSD project for submitting to our team and the 20 products we support. Currently, we have 40 groups that the request types are organized into.  Feedback has been that finding the request could be easier to manage. 

Looking at Atlassian's Website, the support.Atlassian.com is acting as a landing page and directs teams to the correct service desk.   Thanking along this same approach, we would like to have multiple levels for organizing request types.

*Current behavior of JSD 7.2.x:*
 * Project
 ** Group
 *** Request Type

 

*Desired Behavior* 
 * Project
 ** Catagory
 *** Group
 **** Request Type

 

*Example* 
 * Atlassian Support Team (Project) 
 ** JIRA (Catagory) 
 *** JIRA - Standard Requests (Group)
 **** Create New Project (Request Type) 
 **** Create New Group (Request Type) 
 **** Add User to Group (Request Type) 
 *** JIRA - Project Customization Request (Group)
 **** Create New Workflow (Request Type) 
 **** Edit Workflow (Request Type) 
 **** Add/remove Fields to Screen (Request Type) 
 ** Confluence
 *** Conflunce - Standard Requests (Group)
 **** Create New Project (Request Type) 
 **** Create New Group (Request Type) 
 **** Add User to Group (Request Type) 
 *** Confluence - Project Customization Request (Group)
 **** Add Plugin (Request Type) 
 ** HipChat

 *** HipChat - Standard Requests (Group)
 **** Create New Room (Request Type) 
 **** Add Integration to Room (Request Type)
fields.summary: Enable Multi-level organization of Request Types Groups

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create two service desk projects, let us called it Project A and B
# In the Project A, navigate to _Project Administration > Customer Permissions_
# Set the permission to _"Anyone can email the service desk or raise a request in the portal"_.
# This will allow the portal is open for Public Sign Up.
# For Project B, don't change anything as the permission should be _"Customers who have an account on this JIRA site"_
# Access Project A portal with a new session (Use another browser)
# Sign Up to the portal and you will in.
# Navigate to Project B and tries to log in.

h3. Expected Results:
* With the fact that the customer is only signing up to Project A, it will not be able to access Project B

h3. Actual Result:
* The user will be able to access Project B portal.

h3. Notes:
* With this, the customer would be able to bypass any Portal that is not allowed to log in by finding any Portal that allows them to do so. As long the permission is _"Customers who have an account on this JIRA site"_, they will be able to log in by finding any portal that allows them to sign up.
fields.summary: Public Sign Up will allows customers to access other Portals.

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+

When a user is already logged in and tries to navigate (or gets redirected) to a link like:
* <baseurl>/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/user/login?destination=portal%2F1%3Fusername%3Dadmin

(i) SD first decodes the destination correctly as _portal/1?username=admin_

(!) But then treats the entire destination param as part of path

(x) As a result, '*?*' gets encoded back to '*%3F*', leading to Page not found.

h4. +Note+
This seems to happen when a custom authenticator is used, which adds an extra redirection as in the example above.
fields.summary: Customer portal login incorrectly handles destination param if it includes query

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4737].
  {panel}

h3. Description of problem

Custom field has global context and additional context with different options. Additional context is set for JSD project.

JSD search fields allow custom field to be selected and present options for global context. Does not show options configured in additional context tied to JSD project.

Reproduced in:
 * Server 3.3.0
 * Cloud v3.3.0-OD-1000.846.0 / JIRA v1000.718.6

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create JSD project
 # Create new checkbox custom field with "Global" value, add to JSD project screens.
 # Create new context for custom field, associate with JSD project. Add value "JSDvalue"
 # Attempt to add field to JSD project queue, automation, or reports
 ** For example, create new queue and in basic "Issues to show" select the new field and try to select value.

h3. Experienced behavior
Custom field presents options tied to global context. These are the incorrect options.
 * Does not show options tied to JSD project context.

h3. Expected behavior
JSD shows correct values in basic search dropdown.
 * These would be the options set for the context tied to the JSD project.

h3. Workaround
Use the advanced search option to configure the report, queue, or automation rule.

h3. Additional notes
Request types work properly, showing the options from the project specific context and no options from global context.
 * The portal presents the correct options
 * When hiding field the default option selection shows correct options
fields.summary: Basic search in JSD shows incorrect options when custom field restricted by project context

fields.description:
h3. Description of Problem:

JIRA Server instances that have had JSD in the past may have trouble installing JSD 3.2+ if they ever had JSD in the past and did not go through JSD 3.0/3.1 to complete the necessary upgrade tasks.

Or, they might be able to install JSD 3.2+, but they won't be able to create any new Service Desk Project, and will see the following error in the logs:
{code:java}
2019-01-29 02:14:05,217 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [bootstrap.lifecycle.server.ServerPluginLifeCycle] '2.0.2' version of Service Desk cannot be upgraded to '3.9.2-REL-0010'. Upgrade to '3.0.0' <= <version> < '3.2.0' first.
com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.server.UnsatisfiedVersionRequirementException: '2.0.2' version of Service Desk cannot be upgraded to '3.9.2-REL-0010'. Upgrade to '3.0.0' <= <version> < '3.2.0' first.
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.server.UpgradeRequirementsChecker.checkVersionRequirementForUpgrade(UpgradeRequirementsChecker.java:47)
{code}
In some cases JSD data is unwanted and can be deleted. For example when JSD was previously installed as a trial.
h3. Suggestion

Add a supported method for removing all JSD data from the instance.

Use case and suggestion:
 # Customer upgrading from JSD 2.5.9 or under and does not wish to keep any JSD data (JSD was a trial, or any other reason)
 ** If desired, customer is able to remove all JSD data so that they can install JSD anytime in the future
 # Customer who is currently running JIRA 7.2 and up and is trying to install JSD. Unbeknownst to the customer JSD was installed in earlier version and 3.0/3.1 upgrade tasks were not completed.
 ** Customer is able to drop all JSD data so that they can install JSD without having to attempt downgrade.

Suggesting adding a startup flag that tells JSD to drop all JSD data
h3. Workaround

We have [documented a method for deleting data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deleting-data-from-old-jira-service-desk-versions-3-2-and-below-to-unblock-the-upgrade-1063172681.html] from old Jira Service Desk versions (3.2 and below) to unblock upgrades to modern versions.


If you’re using one of the earlier versions of Jira Service Desk (3.2 or below), some data might be incompatible and can block you from upgrading to the latest version or migrating to Jira Service Management Cloud. This often happens when an instance is upgraded without going through versions 3.0 and 3.1, which run important upgrade tasks.


Please follow the steps on the documentation to manually remove the Jira Service Desk add-on, related directories, and other incompatible data.
fields.summary: Unable to install JSM if data exists from version prior to 3.2 upgrade steps

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4731].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

If the *Add Comments* project permission is removed from the *Service Desk Customer - Portal Access* role, customers sending in emails to comment on their own tickets will instead end up creating a new email with that comment, leading to confusion.

h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce logging into the application logs which inform the user specifically why Issues are being created rather than the original issue being commented, such as:

"Service Desk Customer - Portal Access missing Add Comments project permission, creating issue instead"

Alternatively, if the email can be recognized as being related to an existing issue, reject the email outright with similar logging:

"Service Desk Customer - Portal Access missing Add Comments project permission, skipping..." 

h3. Why this is important
 
While this is not inherently a bug and is intended behavior, there could be improvements in the logging or messaging that is provided to the user, since it isn't necessarily clear that the resulting behavior is that a new issue is created, rather than the email being rejected outright. This could be done in the application logging, or via clearer errors/warnings in the UI project permissions.
fields.summary: Improve logging for when new issues are created when Add Comments project permission is not granted to Service Desk Customer - Portal Access

fields.description:
As result of scala to java conversion [https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/FREE-575]
updating of profile started unconditionally call crowdService.updateUser in CustomerProfileService#updateUserBasicInfo which fails if underline AD is read-only

Should call it only if display name or email address is requested to change
h5. Steps to Reproduce.
 # Connect JIRA to an Active Directory that is read-only
 # Fetch your Service Desk customers from this active directory.
 # Go to customer portal and attempt to change the customer's profile language to a different one.

h5. Expected

JIRA would change the language and store the information in the database.
h5. Actual

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

JIRA would attempt to update the active directory and throw an error that it cannot update the directory because of directory settings.
h3. Notes
 * Replicable using ApacheDirectory Studio with Read Only with Local Groups
 * Error in the logs will be:
{noformat}
2017-02-08 18:55:03,733 http-nio-8730-exec-25 ERROR apache4 1135x245x1 1jeqvkj 10.60.6.142 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/user [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationNotPermittedException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: Cannot update user 'apache4' because directory 'Atlassian Test' does not allow updates.
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationNotPermittedException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: Cannot update user 'apache4' because directory 'Atlassian Test' does not allow updates.
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.user.CustomerProfileService.updateUserWithValidatedRequest(CustomerProfileService.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.user.CustomerProfileService.lambda$updateProfile$0(CustomerProfileService.java:96)
...
 {noformat}
* It affects avatar as well.

h3. Workaround 
Use Read/Write LDAP Permission 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
(i) Not possible with a federated active directory configuration.
fields.summary: Update of customer language setting fails when user is from an active directory

h3. Summary

When adding or removing a customer from an organization it does not update on existing tickets.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Scenario 1
 # Create a ticket with user-a as a reporter.
 # Add user-a to an organization-a.

Scenario 2
 # User-a has been updated with an organization based on steps above.
 # User-a has an existing ticket with the organization-a
 # Remove user-a from organization-a

h3. Expected Results

Scenario 1 existing ticket would be updated to reflect the organization. 
 Scenario 2 existing tickets would have the organization removed as the reporter is no longer part of the organization.

 Scenario 2: It would remove the organization from existing tickets since the customer is no longer part of the organization.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4723].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 14th July 2017}
{panel}
Hello customers,

Thank you for providing input on improvements to JIRA Service Desk.

We recommend that agents add organisations in one of the following ways:
 * To add an organisation when you raise a ticket: In the agent view, use the Raise a request link in the sidebar to go to the portal and raise a ticket on behalf of the customer (check out our documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/raising-requests-on-behalf-of-customers-747602734.html]).
 * To add an organisation to an existing ticket: In the agent view, view an issue and update the Organization field in the People panel.

Our original vision was for both customers and agents to create requests from the portal or email, not the agent view. But, from the feedback we've received so far, we understand that this method doesn't work for all teams. To help us improve this experience in the future, we're changing this bug to a feature request so we can continue to gather feedback.

Thanks,

— JIRA Service Desk Team

 

 
----
h3. Summary

The organization field can be added to the Create Screen but once added, it actually doesn't appear in the screen when creating new issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the _Organization_ field to the Create Issue screen of a Service Desk project
 # Try to create an issue via JIRA (not customer portal)

h3. Expected Results
 # The _Organization_ field is visible and can be selected

h3. Actual Results

The field doesn't appear in the screen
h3. Notes

It correctly appears in the Edit Issue scren
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Organization field does not appear in Create Issue screen (not portal)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4722].
  {panel}

Please can you start working on a customisable customer portal?  The current layout is very basic, and can't be properly customised to our branding.  We can only add a logo and change the banner colour.

We currently use Freshdesk, which while we know is serveral years ahead of you in development, is almost completely customisable.  Where they haven't provided some customisation, html code is available to tweak.

I would recommend a similar tab system, of knowledge base and tickets, allowing users to easily self-help and raise tickets, and review their tickets.

As an organisation, we're hoping to move to JIRA Service Desk, as we use all your other products, but in it's current form, it would be taking 10 steps back from the client perspective, with no additional benefit from agent usability.

If this work is in the pipeline, can you tell me when you might be looking to launch your revised customer portal?

Many thanks,

Amber
fields.summary: Improvements to Customer Portal

h4. +Scenario+
Take Time to Resolution for example, which is an SLA that can be reset:
# Configure a goal that will breach in 1 minute
# Create an issue that follows the goal, wait more than 1 minute, then resolve it for the SLA to breach
# Reopen the issue for the SLA to be reset
# Resolve it within 1 minute for the SLA to be achieved
# Reopen it again and resolve it for the SLA to be achieved again

From the SLA panel:
* The previous statuses of the SLA are recorded, one Breached and one Achieved
* The current SLA status is Achieved
!sla.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Suggestion+
Since the SLA has breached once, the Breached status should be displayed/highlighted instead of the current status.
fields.summary: If an SLA can be reset and has breached at least once, highlight the breached status instead of the current status

h3. Problem
If the *Administrators role* doesn't have the following required permissions, JIRA Service Desk displays a warning until the permissions are granted. This has also been explained in [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/resolving-permission-scheme-errors-838416389.html].
* Browse Projects
* Administer Projects
* Edit Issues

h3. Suggestion
The Administer Projects permission is necessary but not the _Browse Projects_ and _Edit Issues_ permissions. Please treat this as a minor permission error or a warning and make it dismissable.

h3. Why is this important
Admin will still be able to administer the project even without the _Browse Projects_ and _Edit Issues_ permissions, hence the error message should be changed or dismissable to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: The Administrators role does not necessarily need to have the Browse Projects permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4700].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Since 3.3.0, notification emails are now combined together if multiple activities happen around the same time.
* For example, a new request created by a customer via email and an Agent respond to the customer immediately when the request appears in the queue. The customer will receive one email only with the request created message, Agent's comment and status change message in a conversation format.

h3. Suggestion
It should be configurable whether the notification should be sent in the conversation format or not, the emails shouldn't be combined

h3. Why is this important
# With the default format of email, users are prone to overlook the important message in the email.
# Customers are expected to receive an email to confirm on request created, and another email when the Agent replies to the request. With the combined email, customers might just ignore the first email as they will treat it as just a confirmation email.
fields.summary: As an admin, I do not want the customer notification emails to be combined or sent with conversation format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4699].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
After changing a Software type project to Service Desk type, the Request types will be automatically generated based on conditions below.
* If there are more than 2 existing components in the project, 2 of the components and 1 of the issue types will be copied as the Request Types.
* If there is only 1 existing component in the project, that particular component and 2 of the issue types will be copied as the Request Types.
* If there is no existing component in the project, 3 of the issue types will be copied as the Request Types.

h3. Suggestion
Allow admins to choose which component or issue type should be copied as a Request Type

h3. Why is it important
Randomly creating the Request Types from existing components and issue types requires additional workload to the admin. It should be flexible enough to let admin to decide which ones should be used.
fields.summary: Changing a Software type project to Service Desk type should allow admin to select Request Types from Components and Issue types

h3. Problem
There is a panel in every request showing a list of users whom the request has been shared with, even if the request is not shared with anyone else except the reporter him/herself.
However, it's not configurable to hide the list of user(s).

h3. Suggestion
* Allow to show/hide the list of user(s)

h3. Why is this important
# The list is shown even when the request is not shared with anyone, the information does not need to be there.
# In some use cases, we do not want any customer to see the user list as there might be incidents where the request is shared with customers from different organizations or etc and this will impact the business.
# It's not necessary for the customers to know whom are they sharing the request with.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:

At the moment for JIRA Service Desk 3.3, on the page, that is a message that a satisfaction feedback will be sent out when an issue is resolved. But, there is no information about the prerequisite that it comes out with "Request Resolved" notification and only Service Desk generated notifications.

Then, for JIRA Service Desk prior to 3.3, the documentation did not mention that the feature only works for JIRA Service Desk generated notifications. Hence, if the "JSD Global Notification" option is disabled in which the option is not available anymore on version 3.3, the Satisfaction Feedback would not be included even though it is enabled.
 - [Collecting Customer Notification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Collecting+customer+satisfaction+%28CSAT%29+feedback]

h3. Suggested Solution:

For the settings in version 3.3, a message which mentions that the "Request Resolved" notification is needed will be great. While the documentation on the previous version is updated that mentions it only works for JIRA Service Desk generated notifications.
h3. Why is it needed:

To prevent any misunderstanding on how the Satisfaction Feedback expected to work.e
fields.summary: Satisfaction Setting message improvements

h5. +Usage Summary+

When a JIRA Admin wants to trigger the Satisfaction survey to be sent out on specific issue types, there is no way to customize and set this up as JIRA allows you to only enable or disable it.

h5. +Usage Scenario+

If a company has multiple request types that require very different usage scenarios(*bug report* vs *request time off*) and different target customers(bug report is meant for customers mainly while request time off is meant for their employees).

Should both of these happen to be in the same service desk project, once the satisfaction survey is enabled, there is no way for them to specify when a survey should be sent based on request type.

h5. +Feature Request+

Improve the functionality of the satisfaction survey to allow users to specify which request types should trigger it.

h5. +Workaround+

In the mean time, we would suggest having different projects for request types you want surveys to be sent for when the issue is closed and those that you do not want to have a notification sent for.
fields.summary: Allow Customization of Service Desk survey trigger

  {panel}

Allow an attached or imported csv file to be added as a comment which is automatically formatted as a table.

Reason for Requirement:
 * Displaying search results/outputs from external systems
 * When dealing with logs in particular, it's important to have the ability to highlight key rows
 * Saving time from opening/downloading attached files
 * Allowing key attached data to be searchable

Currently I partially solve this problem by pushing csv files through a local script. Unfortunately this isn't user friendly and takes more time than necessary.

There are a number of discussions and tools that also partially solve this problem, so there is definitely demand for a native feature like this:
 * [http://excel2jira.bluurgh.com/]
 * [http://www.exceltojira.com/]
 * [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/111762/convert-a-spreadsheet-into-a-table]
 * [https://github.com/bennadel/JIRA-CSV-Formatter]

Note: I'm unsure whether this fits better under JIRA Software or JIRA Service Desk. Feel free to move it if required.
fields.summary: Create a Table From a CSV or Excel attachment

h3. Problem
The Default service desk project configuration documentation is outdated. 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER033/Default+service+desk+project+configuration

The title may also need to be changed to "Default JIRA Service Desk project configuration" 

h3. Details of problem

h5. Database tables: 

The article includes database tables and this list is incomplete. Example missing would be AO_C7F17E_LINGO added in 3.3. Approvals are another example of missing tables. 
* The other content on the page appears to be things that are unlikely to change between versions. The database tables do change as new features are released.

h5. Custom Fields

The list of custom fields is outdated.
* Other fields are included with JSD install, for example "Request Participants"
* Creation of JSD projects results in the creation of additional custom fields. For example creating IT Service Desk project will create 17 custom fields if they do not already exist. Example field "Product Categorization"

h3. Suggested Solution
It is great to have the list of database tables that are related to JSD. In addition the custom fields need to be updated. 

If it will be difficult to keep this updated I suggest moving this to be a KB article so that support can assist with maintaining this. A link to the KB article could be placed on the documentation page.
fields.summary: Outdated Documentation - Default service desk project configuration

{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 30th October 2017}
{panel}
Hello all,

Thanks for all your comments. We would love to hear from you on what you’d expect from this feature improvement. Understanding this helps us craft the right thing, that fits your needs.

If you would like to help out, please take 2 minutes to answer these questions - [https://jsd-explorations.typeform.com/to/XlzAoY]

Cheers,

— JIRA Service Desk Team

h3. Summary

When there are multiple approvers added in a transition, users will not receive any notification until all approvers have approved the transition. It would be useful to have notifications to be sent out when each of them approves, so that the users would know exactly who has/has not approved without logging in to the customer portal or JSD.

h3. Suggestion

JSD should fire a system event, ie Issue Approved. So that JSD admin can customize who should receive the notification in the notification scheme.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4663].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When an email requests adds a comment and adds request participants to a request, then an SLA can be in an incorrect state (not running, not paused, not stopped). The propability for this to happen is when the email triggers an automation rule and that rule triggers an SLA change.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workflow for your project that has the states "Waiting for Support", "Waiting for Customer" and "Resolved"
 ## The initial state of the workflow should be "Waiting for Support"
 ## The end state of the Workflow should be "Resolved"
 ## A transition from "Waiting for Support" to "Waiting for Customer" has to exist
 # Create an SLA that

 ## Starts when the request enters status "Waiting for Customer"
 ## Pauses when the request is in status "Waiting for Support"
 ## Stops when the request enters status "Resolved"
 # Create an automation rule

 ## When comment is added to an issue
 ## Then transitions issue from "Waiting for support" to "Waiting for Customer
 # Create a new request that uses the above workflow
 # Send an email to the system that will
 ## Trigger a comment on the request
 ## Add participants to the request

h3. Expected Results
 # A comment is added to the issue
 # The request participants are added to the issue
 # The SLA is running

h3. Actual Results

In some cases the SLA is not running
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: When an email message comments and adds request participants at the same time the value of an SLA can be in the wrong state

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4662].
  {panel}

A particular use case that has come up is the need to raise a service desk issue into an organization.

Example:
 * Agent identifies an issue and wishes to notify a customer (or organiztion)
 * Monitoring system raises an issue

Because an agent may be the one to raise the issue, they should stick as the reporter – but would also be the assignee. This is noted as a bad idea since it messes with satisfying SLAs – especially when the SLAs may include conditions such as "Comment: For customer".

Of course, there's also the point that when raising an issue into an organization, which of the members of this organization should be assigned or receiving notifications about this issue?

I don't think this is a rare or even obscure use case so maybe it could become a priority?

A workaround that we're working with is creating an internal user part of the organization only used by the agents with which we can raise issues. This is a pretty dirty workaround though...

Thanks!
fields.summary: Support for agent to raise an issue into a client organization

h4. Problem Definition
Newly created portal users through Google Apps Sync do not come with any organization as default. You can only choose an organization if inserting the customer directly to a project. Being able to automatically assign them to a default organization would resolve this.


h4. Suggested Solution

h5. +Issue Summary+

Following the release of JIRA 3.3, when a user sets their preferred language to a different language than the default, most items appear in the language set by the customer.

The problem however is that Request types and descriptions are not changed and appear in the language they were created in.

For example: We have a Request type: *Request Account* with the Description *Request to have an Account Created to access the System*, if the user who is a German speaker changes the language from English to Deustch, the request types and their descriptions would still be in the default set by the portal admin.

h5. +Steps to Reproduce+

# Create a new Request type in a Service Desk project that is in English Language.
# Go to customer portal.
# Set the language preference at the customer portal to French or any non English language.
# Attempt to create an issue.

h5. +Expected Behavior+

JIRA would show the names of request types and their description in the language the user selected.

h5. +Actual Behavior+

JIRA would show the request type and it's description in the language configured from the JIRA UI of the project by the project Admin.
fields.summary: Improvement to JIRA Service Desk Translation.

h3. Summary
There a number of default reports where users are able to select a time period for the report (eg. 48h, 7days, 1month, etc). Once the period is selected, the issues will be displayed but will be separated depending on the period. For example, if the period is 7 days, the issues will be shown separated per day. However, there isn't a *Total* figure which users can easily click to see results for *all* issues in that period

h3. Suggestion
Add another row to display total issues for that period. It should also be a link which will allow users to navigate to the Issue Navigator directly
